summary: This is an email forwarding sealed documents filed in the case US v. Maxwell (Case No. 20-3061) to the Second Circuit Court of Appeals. It includes attachments of a motion to consolidate and an exhibit, sent by the law firm Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C.

events.title: Filing of Sealed Documents in US v. Maxwell
events.description: Sealed documents, including a motion to consolidate and an exhibit, were filed in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell and forwarded to the Second Circuit Court of Appeals.

locations.name: Denver, Colorado
locations.context: Location of the law firm Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C. at 150 East 10th Avenue.

locations.name: Second Circuit Court of Appeals
locations.context: Court to which the sealed documents in US v. Maxwell were being sent.

keyFacts: Sealed documents were filed in the criminal case US v. Maxwell (Case No. 20-3061) on September 10, 2020.
The documents included a 'Motion to Consolidate' and an 'Exhibit B' to that motion.
The correspondence was sent by the law firm Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C., acting at the request of an unspecified party.
The email was forwarded on September 11, 2020, indicating ongoing legal proceedings in the Maxwell case.
The document is part of the Epstein case data set, linking the Maxwell prosecution to the broader Epstein investigation.
